Essential Question:
How can we graphically represent multiple forces acting on an object?

Enduring Understandings:
1. [OBJ:expsec_e777:Free-body diagrams] are representations of the forces acting upon an object. The forces in a free-body diagram start from the origin of the object and point in the direction of the force. The length of the force vector corresponds to the magnitude of the force.
2. Free-body diagrams can be drawn for objects when the [OBJ:expsec_e778:forces are not acting on a line]. The same rules for drawing free-body diagrams for forces acting on a line apply to free-body diagrams for forces not acting on a line.
